content.text:
# Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Individual Performance in a Variety or Music Program

}}
The Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Individual Performance in a Variety or Music Program was an annual award given to performers in a variety/music series or specials. The award has been retired; it was last presented in 2008.
Winners and nominations
was the innagural winner of this award in 1959.]]
won in 1960.]]
won in 1961.]]
won twice consecutively in 1962 and 1963.]]
won in 1964.]]
won twice consecutively in 1965 and 1966.]]
won four times in 1969, 1971, 1972 and 1974.]]
won thrice in 1973, 1977, and 1978.]]
won twice in 1975 and 1984.]]
won in 1976.]]
won in 1978.]]
won in 1977.]]
won twice in 1979 and 1989.]]
won in 1982.]]
won in 1984.]]
won in 1984.]]
won in 1985.]]
won in 1986.]]
won in 1987.]]
won twice consecutively in 1987 and 1988.]]
won in 1989.]]
won thrice in 1989, 1991, and 1998 for hosting both the Grammys and the Oscars (out of 14 nominations).]]
won in twice 1992 and 1997.]]
won twice in 1990 and 1994.]]
won in 1993.]]
won twice in 1995 and 2001.]]
won in twice in 1996 and 2007.]]
won in 1999.]]
won 2000.]]
won in 2002.]]
in 2003.]]
won in 2004.]]
won in 2005.]]
in 2006.]]
won in 2008.]]
